channel.title: CVE Feed for Red Hat, Inc. -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Red Hat, Inc. -- all products

item.title: CVE-2018-10861|2024-09-16T16:28:46.914Z -- red%20hat%2C%20inc. -- ceph
item.description: A flaw was found in the way ceph mon handles user requests. Any authenticated ceph user having read access to ceph can delete, create ceph storage pools and corrupt snapshot images. Ceph branches master, mimic, luminous and jewel are believed to be affected.

item.title: CVE-2018-1049|2024-09-16T16:47:41.544Z -- red%20hat%2C%20inc. -- systemd
item.description: In systemd prior to 234 a race condition exists between .mount and .automount units such that automount requests from kernel may not be serviced by systemd resulting in kernel holding the mountpoint and any processes that try to use said mount will hang. A race condition like this may lead to denial of service, until mount points are unmounted.

item.title: CVE-2019-3813|2024-09-16T16:23:33.117Z -- red%20hat%2C%20inc. -- spice
item.description: Spice, versions 0.5.2 through 0.14.1, are vulnerable to an out-of-bounds read due to an off-by-one error in memslot_get_virt. This may lead to a denial of service, or, in the worst case, code-execution by unauthenticated attackers.

item.title: CVE-2018-1106|2024-09-16T16:18:44.131Z -- red%20hat%2C%20inc. -- packagekit
item.description: An authentication bypass flaw has been found in PackageKit before 1.1.10 that allows users without administrator privileges to install signed packages. A local attacker can use this vulnerability to install vulnerable packages to further compromise a system.

item.title: CVE-2017-15099|2024-09-16T16:43:27.924Z -- red%20hat%2C%20inc. -- postgresql
item.description: INSERT ... ON CONFLICT DO UPDATE commands in PostgreSQL 10.x before 10.1, 9.6.x before 9.6.6, and 9.5.x before 9.5.10 disclose table contents that the invoker lacks privilege to read. These exploits affect only tables where the attacker lacks full read access but has both INSERT and UPDATE privileges. Exploits bypass row level security policies and lack of SELECT privilege.

item.title: CVE-2018-1082|2024-09-16T16:43:01.540Z -- red%20hat%2C%20inc. -- moodle
item.description: A flaw was found in Moodle 3.4 to 3.4.1, and 3.3 to 3.3.4. If a user account using OAuth2 authentication method was once confirmed but later suspended, the user could still login to the site.
